summary: This bill, the Shutdown Guidance for Financial Institutions Act, mandates that federal financial regulators issue guidance to financial institutions. This guidance encourages institutions to assist consumers and businesses affected by government shutdowns. It includes working with those facing hardship, modifying loan terms, and preventing negative credit reporting. The bill also requires a post-shutdown report to Congress and updated guidance if necessary. It defines key terms like "consumers affected by a shutdown" and specifies which federal agencies are considered "Federal financial regulators".
